page.title: 16Day in Life of a Resident
page.content: At{Calderstones}the day beins at{ {7:30am}when the resident is awakened and breakfast is served on the ward. From{9:00}until{12:00}the resident attends training classes.These are usually occupational or home management classes where the resident is taught the basic skills of living, the correct forms of behaviour and how to spend leisure time wisely. The training given aims to prepare the resident for future integration into the community. At{12:00}the resident returns to his ward for lunch.Further training takes place during the afternoon until{4:00. { }The evening meal is served at{5:00} and from{6:00}the resident is allowed recreational time.This may be spent on the ward-watching T.V.,at night school organised within the hospital,or at the popular{'73 Club.
